tables.title: Landmark Snapshots
tables.description: Memorable places that can anchor scenes or clues.

entries.result: A skybridge botanical garden filled with orchids and hidden security cameras.
A waterfront pier converted into a pop-up art gallery of controversial installations.
A half-finished skyscraper wrapped in tarps where parkour groups practice at night.
An underground speakeasy accessed through a laundromat's broken dryer door.
A micro-museum of vintage electronics curated by a retired radio operator.
A rooftop urban farm buzzing with drones and guarded by territorial geese.
A decommissioned subway platform hosting nightly food stalls after trains stop.
A courthouse plaza featuring a sculpture that casts different shadows every hour.
A shipping container village offering short-term offices and hidden meeting rooms.
A community center with an unused panic shelter sealed behind fresh paint.

tables.title: Breaking News
tables.description: Headlines that can redirect attention or provide misdirection.

entries.result: City council votes on emergency surveillance funding after overnight fires.
Anonymous source leaks traffic camera footage showing a mysterious van.
Celebrity chef collapses live on air, sparking food contamination fears.
Rolling blackout leaves several wards dark; radio nets light up with rumors.
Amateur livestream captures odd lights above the harbor before cutting out.
Museum staff report an empty display case with no broken locks.
Charity gala evacuated due to an unclaimed briefcase; security footage missing.
Health department issues alert about counterfeit pharmaceuticals.

tables.title: Law Enforcement Moves
tables.description: Actions taken by police or private security that reshape a scene.

entries.result: A task force sets up a mobile command van and perimeter cameras.
Detectives quietly circulate a list of persons of interest to patrol units.
Undercover officers blend with the crowd, looking for a specific tattoo.
A helicopter spotlight sweeps alleys while loudspeakers order dispersal.
A cybercrime analyst requests devices for on-the-spot data imaging.
A K9 unit arrives, and handlers warn they will search vehicles next.

tables.title: Witness Profiles
tables.description: People with partial information, odd habits, and possible motives.

entries.result: A night-shift janitor who collected discarded visitor badges as souvenirs.
A taxi driver who records every ride for a true-crime podcast.
A graffiti artist who tags only near government buildings and noticed extra patrols.
A dog walker whose smart collar app logs precise routes and timestamps.
A street magician who saw reflections in a window that didn't match reality.
A food delivery cyclist whose insulated bag hides a jammer and camera.
A retiree who documents city birds and caught unusual drone behavior.
A radio scanner hobbyist with recordings of encrypted bursts at odd hours.
A university student researching architecture who sketched a hidden door.
A street preacher who claims the city's statues whisper after midnight.

tables.title: Field Clues
tables.description: Physical traces that can pivot an investigation.

entries.result: A burner phone containing only map pins along the river.
A torn invitation to a gala with a hand-sketched seating chart.
Boot prints with traces of stage blood and glitter.
A keycard that still smells of chlorine and faint ozone.
Receipts for industrial-strength batteries purchased in bulk.
A hidden camera disguised as a car freshener with one image remaining.
A set of folded maps with routes highlighted to avoid CCTV coverage.
A soil sample bag labeled with GPS coordinates that don't exist on maps.
